frame.name: Secrecy_status
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Phenomenon</fen>, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential <fen>Cognizer</fen>. The person responsible for the hiding of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is not part of this frame and cannot be syntactically realized. The potential <fen>Cognizer</fen> may be realized, but is in fact rarely expressed. A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is secret may be indicated.
<ex>Few people would use ATMs if <fex name="phe">the content of their transaction</fex> <m>was</m> <t>secret</t> <fex name="cog">from their bank</fex> and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .</ex>
<ex>The protesters were not on her list, and weren't allowed in, despite the fact that <fex name="phe">the meeting</fex> <m>was</m> <t>public</t>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="phe">Student disciplinary matters</fex> are <t>confidential</t> and should only be discussed with appropriate university officials</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from cognizers.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
<ex>There was stuff in there that was '<t>secret</t>' <fex name="Time">in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who might become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> if it was not concealed.
<ex>Moreover, the blood and decorations were sacred and could only be removed in a procedure which was <t>secret</t> <fex name="cog">from women</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Epistemic_stance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE modifies the target to indicate the legal- or "by rule" domain within which it is true or operational. This legal domain is in contrast to reality, which may or may not reflect the "official" state-of-affairs. This FE can be realized in words like "formally" and"officially" plus maybe "technically" and "in law."</def-root>

lexUnit.name: covert.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not openly acknowledged or displayed.

lexUnit.name: secret.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not known or seen or not meant to be known or seen by others

lexUnit.name: secretly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: in a secret manner, in secret

lexUnit.name: public.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: done, perceived, or existing in open view.

lexUnit.name: confidential.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: intended to be kept secret

lexUnit.name: publicly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: done, perceived, or existing in open view

lexUnit.name: unclassified.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not officially designated as secret.
